resources.string: Plug in Raspberry Pi via USB
Plug n Pi seems not running on Raspberry Pi. Please enable it.
The app does not support the version of protocol used by Raspberry Pi. Please update the app.
You did not permit the app to talk to Raspberry Pi. Re-plug to try again.
Unable to connect Raspberry Pi. Re-plug to try again.

string.name: pi_is_plugged
string.u: But I\'m sure it\'s plugged in!

resources.string:
Is the phone charging?
 
If not, make sure Raspberry Pi is powered on and USB cable is fully plugged in.
 
If phone is charging, the USB cable may not have a data connection. Use one that has data wires.
 
It is also possible that Raspberry Pi is under-voltage and is straining to supply power to the phone. Try a better power adapter.
Try removing all USB attachments from Raspberry Pi, then re-plug phone to Raspberry Pi.\n \nIf that still fails, re-start phone and Raspberry Pi to try again.
This is an open network. No passphrase is required.
Raspberry Pi is rebooting. Connection will be back up soon.
